title: Chocolate Orange Marble Cake
description: This moist and visually stunning Chocolate Orange Marble Cake combines the rich depth of unsweetened chocolate with the bright zestiness of fresh orange. Perfect for brunch or dessert, it’s a delightful treat that balances citrus and cocoa flavors in a tender, fluffy cake.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour one 10-inch tube pan.
In a large bowl, cream the butter with 1 cup of the white sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, then add vanilla extract and yogurt, mixing well.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
Gradually beat the dry ingredients into the creamed mixture until just combined.
Divide the batter evenly into two bowls.
Stir the orange zest into one bowl of batter.
Add the melted chocolate to the other bowl and mix thoroughly.
Alternately spoon the orange and chocolate batters into the prepared tube pan.
Use a knife to swirl through the batters to create a marbled effect.
Bake for 50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
While the cake is baking, mix the remaining 1/4 cup sugar, orange juice, and orange liqueur to make the glaze.
As soon as the cake is removed from the oven, pour the glaze evenly over the hot cake.
Allow the cake to cool completely on a wire rack before removing from the pan and serving.
tips: For the best marble effect, don’t over-swirl the batters; a few gentle swirls create beautiful patterns. Use fresh orange zest for vibrant flavor and melt the chocolate gently to avoid graininess. Let the glaze soak in while the cake is still warm for a moist, flavorful finish.

structured_content.content: Experience the perfect harmony of rich chocolate and bright orange in this stunning marble cake. Its moist texture and beautiful swirls make it a feast for both the eyes and palate, ideal for special occasions or cozy gatherings.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 1 hour
  • Restaurant-quality flavors at home
  • Perfect for brunch, celebrations, or afternoon tea
  • Uses simple, everyday ingredients
  • Beautiful marbled appearance that impresses guests

structured_content.content: This cake holds a special place in my kitchen memories, reminding me of joyful family brunches where the aroma of orange and chocolate filled the air, inviting everyone to gather around and share smiles over a slice.

structured_content.headline: Gather Your Ingredients
structured_content.content:
• Main ingredient: Unsweetened chocolate provides deep cocoa flavor without overpowering sweetness; melt gently to maintain smoothness.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Fresh orange zest and liqueur brighten the cake with citrus notes; choose ripe, fragrant oranges for best zest.
  • Supporting ingredients: Plain yogurt adds moisture and tenderness, while baking powder and soda ensure a light crumb.
  • Equipment needed: 10-inch tube pan for even baking and a sharp knife for swirling the batter.

structured_content.headline: How to Make It
structured_content.content:
Preparation:
Cream butter and sugar until fluffy, then add eggs, vanilla, and yogurt for a smooth batter. Mix dry ingredients separately before combining to avoid lumps.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Divide batter, flavor each half, then alternate spooning into pan. Swirl gently with a knife for a marbled effect. Bake at 350°F for 50 minutes until a toothpick comes out clean.
Finishing Touches:
Pour the orange liqueur glaze over the hot cake to infuse extra moisture and flavor. Cool completely before serving for best texture.

upload.context: Beautiful finished dish with vibrant colors and appetizing presentation

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Maintain oven temperature at 350°F for even baking without drying out the cake.
  • Avoid over-swizzling the batter to preserve distinct marbled patterns.
  • Look for a clean toothpick as a sign of doneness and a slightly springy top texture.
  • Store wrapped at room temperature for up to 3 days or refrigerate; reheat gently before serving.

structured_content.content: Sharing this cake with loved ones always brings warmth and smiles, making celebrations feel even more special. Its inviting aroma and delightful flavors create lasting memories around the table.

structured_content.headline: Flavor Boosters
structured_content.content: Enhance the cake by adding a pinch of cinnamon or nutmeg to the batter for subtle warmth. Swap orange liqueur for Grand Marnier or add a splash of coffee to the chocolate batter for depth. Garnish with candied orange peel or a dusting of powdered sugar for elegance.

structured_content.headline: Serving Suggestions
structured_content.content: Serve slices with a dollop of whipped cream or vanilla ice cream for dessert. Pair with fresh berries or a cup of black tea or coffee for brunch. This cake also shines alongside a citrus salad for a refreshing contrast.

structured_content.headline: Creative Variations
structured_content.content: For a gluten-free version, substitute all-purpose flour with a gluten-free blend. Vegan adaptations can use plant-based butter, flax eggs, and dairy-free yogurt. Try replacing orange zest with lemon for a bright twist or use white chocolate instead of dark for a sweeter profile.

upload.context: Close-up detail showing texture, layers, or key visual elements that make the dish appealing

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Cream butter and sugar thoroughly to incorporate air for a light cake.
  • Use room temperature eggs to blend evenly and avoid curdling.
  • Divide batter precisely for balanced marble patterns.
  • Pour glaze while the cake is hot to maximize absorption and flavor.

structured_content.content: With this recipe, you’re set to create a stunning, flavorful cake that delights every time. Enjoy the process and the joyful moments that come with sharing your homemade masterpiece.
